QuestionStem: Explore the diagrams to observe how El Niño conditions influence weather patterns.

images.caption: This diagram shows normal weather conditions.
images.altText: In this diagram, weather conditions over the Pacific in a normal year are shown. The wind moves from west to east. Warm winds push cooler air upward. Rainy weather occurs on the Asian coast.

images.caption: During El Niño conditions, trade winds from east to west weaken and may switch directions. Pacific ocean temperatures are warmer than normal, causing more than usual moisture.
images.altText: In this diagram, the weather conditions in an El Niño year are shown. Wind moves from west to east. Warm water moves to the east as well. Rainfall increases over the western coast of the United States.
